verses.roman:
ṭhākurera bhāṇḍāre āra āmāra bhāṇḍāre
citra-vastra-kiṅkiṇī, āra chatra-cāmare

synonyms: ṭhākurera—of the Deity; bhāṇḍāre—in the storehouse; āra—and; āmāra—my; bhāṇḍāre—in the storehouse; citra-vastra—printed cloth; kiṅkiṇī—small bells; āra—and; chatra—umbrellas; cāmare—yak-tail whisks.
translation: "Take as many printed cloths, small bells, umbrellas and cāmaras as there are in my storehouse and in the Deity's storehouse.
